text: Preheat the oven to 200 °C (392 °F).  Combine the mushrooms, bouquets, salt, and vegetable oil in a metal baking pan. Stir it up a bit to make sure that all of the mushrooms are coated in oil. Cover the pan tightly with aluminum foil. Leave a small space for steam to escape. Roast the mushrooms for 1 - 1 1/2 hours. Check after 1 hour. When the mushrooms are tender, they're done. Drain the mushrooms with your colander. Remove the bouquet. Reserve the oil. You won't need it for this recipe, but it would be a great mushroom and herb infused oil for another recipe. Bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil. Add your pasta. Cook 3-4 minutes, and then drain. Toss the pasta, in a large mixing bowl. Add the mushrooms, truffle oil, cheese, chives, salt and pepper. Serve your new tasty meal.
